div.p: Second wife of Wilhelm Schenker from 1927 to at least 1939.

Nothing is known of Marie’s life before 1927, not even her previous last name. She is never referred to in Heinrich’s diary. Most of 64 letters and postcards from Heinrich to Wilhelm between 1927 and 1934 name her, but merely with closing formulas such as: “Best wishes and kisses to you and dear Marie from us both.” In the ten letters and postcards from Wilhelm to Heinrich and Jeanette between 1930 and 1939 Marie is alluded to (but never by name) and these communications are devoid of information about her, and include no contributions in her hand (not even her signature). She remains a shadow.

Wilhelm’s final words on June 1, 1939 are: “We still live only for the past, and make no plans for tomorrow or the day after. What would be the use?” Nothing is known of the circumstances of the deaths of either Wilhelm or Marie.
